page.title: 11COMMERCIAL FORESTRY LIVERTON
page.content: The{Great Plantation}is partly owned by the{Forestry Commission}and part managed by a private company called{ {Fountain Forestry}which is one of the biggest companies in England. Fountain manage the forest for{Tilt Yard {Holdings}Ltd. Most of the commercial plants were planted after 1935. The Sitka Spruce was planted in 1935 and is going to be cut down in 1990. The largest area was planted in 1942 to 1944.The most recent plantings in the forest were from 1976 to 1982. Commercial trees in the forest are{ {Sitka Spruce,Douglas Fir}and{Japanese {Larch.}The commercial value of the forest is{Â£184,000.}A lot of the wood is made into pulpwood and is sent to South Moulton Papermills. The best timber fetches{Â£45 a tonne}it is used for planking for agricultrual buildings.{
